headline: Brookies (Brownie Cookies)
description: This brookie combines brownie batter and chocolate chip cookie dough to create a decadent half brownie, half cookie bar that's fun and easy to make.

video.description: Brownies meet chocolate chip cookies in the most perfect dessert marriage.
video.name: Brookies (Brownie Cookies)

name: Brookies (Brownie Cookies)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Prepare cookie layer: Beat butter, brown sugar, white sugar, and vanilla in a large bowl until creamy. Add egg; beat until light and creamy, about 2 minutes.

Whisk together flour, salt, and baking soda in a bowl. Gradually stir flour mixture into butter mixture until dough is combined. Stir chocolate chips into dough. Spread dough evenly into the prepared baking dish; set aside.

Prepare brownie layer: Stir together sugar, melted butter, and vanilla in a bowl; add eggs and beat well. Mix in cocoa powder until well-combined. Stir in flour, baking powder, and salt until batter is combined. Pour over cookie layer and spread to cover completely.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes. Cool completely before cutting into 20 bars.

review.reviewBody: After reading reviews I decided to make more cookie dough and add more chocolate to the brownies. My family likes the corner pieces, do I made them in Muffin tins. Wonderful they are, like them much I do

We liked these brookies but felt the brownie layer was not quite chocolatey enough. I made a half recipe in an 8x8 pan and the cookie layer barely covered the pan but the ratio of cookie to brownie seemed to work. I had no trouble pressing the dough in the pan with my hands. If I make these again I will probably try using one less egg in the brownie as others have suggested for a fudgier texture and maybe add a touch more cocoa powder.
It was really good, made it for my school club and for my church!
Baking this tonight, 40 minutes not quite done, 5 more minutes trying, smells sooo good!

Mine turned out wonderful and I got compliments from so many people. That being said, I think the ratio of brownie to cookie dough is a bit off. The cookie dough was definitely way less dough than the brownie dough, which made it hard to spread across the entire 9x13 pan without gaps, and the cookie layer was very thin. It also took much longer to bake than stated (more like 35-40 minutes, not 20-25), and even then the toothpick still had a little brownie on it, but the edges were getting hard, so I just risked it and took it out which turned out fine. Overall a good recipe, I just think there's some things that need to be tweaked.
Good combination.
It was excellent combination, The children were enjoyable to have it at their teatime.
I think adding more sugar to the cookie dough would of been better because it was not sweet at all. Maybe it was just me tho.
Made these for moms birthday,There were no leftovers!

These brookies were awesome!! I loved them so much that after I made them TWICE I tampered with the recipe slightly so instead of chocolate chips I added M&Ms and crushed up Hersheys bars. I also recommend undercooking them slightly. Totally five stars!

This is a great recipe! However‚Ä¶ there is an easy shortcut! I have done this so it works. Buy a Brownie Mix‚Ä¶ prepare as directed‚Ä¶ on top of batter place chocolate cookie dough you can buy in grocery store already prepared‚Ä¶ bake as this recipe says! Easy Peasy and just as delicious ü•≥ü•∞
Not the cookie type I was expecting to end up with, far too cakey and I followed the recipe exactly. Still very yummy though

I made this recipe yesterday and took it to my son's house. Cookies and brownies are my favorite homemade desserts. My daughter-in-law and I like similar desserts and we all thought it was YUMMY! What a great idea to combine two favorites into one. It was easy to make and the only thing I added was pecans. We served it slightly warm with vanilla ice cream. Definitely a keeper!
Loved it.

It was pretty good except the cookie part was way too salty. I will make it again and half the amount of salt and will put the cookie part on top as it needed to be ‚Äúcookier‚Äù(a bit more crisp) as well if that makes sense.

Delicious! A perfect recipe no need to change a thing!
However- I did brown the butter for the cookie layer, used only one egg in brownie layer(based on other reviewer comments), and used only 1/2 C chocolate chip (mini). Next time I will use 2 eggs as recipe says, for comparison. 
No need to make extra batter as some suggested. Just spread out as best you can it will all come together during baking. Thank you for sharing!
CookieBrownies were great! Definitely make more of the cookie batter though because the recipe was 1000% not made for a 9x13 pan. -.-
It was good but the directions confusing- we doubled the recipe but it didn‚Äôt do so for the directions. Thankfully I didn‚Äôt make the mistake- this is just the websites fault-

Yum! I put the brownies on the bottom and cookie layer on top. Instead of spreading the cookie I dropped small pieces of the cookie batter on to brownie layer. It filled in nicely. 
I didn't need the full 40 mins. I also laid a pice of foil on top at about 20 mins left on timer. Removed from oven with 8 mins left. Will make this again! Thanks for the recipe.
AMMMMAAAAZING

These were amazing and barely lasted a day!
I made a few changes per the reviews‚Äî one egg for the brownies and also I smashed the chips into the cookie dough. 
I used the peanut butter chips along with chocolate chips for something different. 
Made in a 9x13 Pyrex greased with butter beforehand. 
You need to let them cool completely before eating so they can actually cut into bars

We made this to share with family and doubled the recipe on the website to 40 servings. Some of the ingredients didn‚Äôt double, so the brownie mix was very dry. We added more cocoa powder and 2 tablespoons of oil and it made the texture much moister. Overall, texture was good but it wasn‚Äôt sweet enough. We dusted the whole thing with powdered sugar and it was perfect the second day. We‚Äôd recommend doubling on your own. It will fill a cookie sheet nicely.

Mine came out perfect! They taste great! I would recommend cutting the sugar a bit because in my opinion full sugar for both the brownie part and the cookie part is too sweet. Mine also had to bake a bit longer than the recipe, but all ovens work differently. I would also recommend waiting to put the chocolate chips in until the dough is in the pan because it is too hard to spread it out with the chocolate. Also, the cookie dough layer will probably seem very thin before baking, but it is supposed to look like that.

great recipe! pro-tip!!!

bake the brownies alone first until they are 75% done and then add the cookie dough on top! (I usually spread the cookie dough onto a piece of greased parchement paper and flip onto the brownies)! everything stays nice and moist and soft!!!
My husband‚Äôs new favorite but had to bake it 35 minutes!
Made no changes. Flavor was just ok, a little oily. We've had much better. The brownie is just meh. Will not make this again.
Made it exactly as described! We gobbled it up!

I made this recipe and it was an immediate hit with my family. One recipe was more than I cared to keep out so I froze half of the batch. Three weeks later I pulled the brookies out of the freezer, let them thaw for an hour or two, and they were as good as the day I baked them.

So good! I made it as a birthday cake with some buttercream frosting for Happy Birthday (doesn‚Äôt need a lot of frosting since it‚Äôs so sweet already), and it was gobbled up. I took advice from one of the reviewers and put the brownie part on the bottom and cookie on top. Otherwise, I followed the recipe.
I made this twice, everyone loved it will make again
A real crowd pleaser. I did not experience any problem spreading the cookie layer.
Tasty! Takes more like 40 mins though.

Taste was really good! Cookie layer hard to spread, so I greased a spatula & spread dough out that way. May try wax paper on top and pressing down next time. Took about 33 minutes cause brownie layer was still like water at 20 minutes. I did use a dark pan which I‚Äôm sure made a difference. Waited 2 hours for them to cool while resting on cooling rack in pan. Used plastic lettuce knife to cut & turned out terrific!

The first time I made it it was undercooked and not the best. After reading some of the reviews I tweaked the recipe and it came out amazing! Only use one egg in the brownie mixture, and put the brownie layer on the bottom. I also baked it for 40 minutes total! It was so good and my new favorite sweet treat!

My 10 year old made these by herself, following the recipe exactly as written; the only part I helped with was spreading the cookie layer on the bottom. She was having a hard time getting an even layer spread out with a wooden spoon. I spread it with a rubber spatula and that worked great. These were yummy and delicious! After trying them my husband said, I can never go back to regular brownies!‚Äù

This is a great recipe. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of five was because of the cookie batter specifically. You would need to increase the ingredients for the cookies because, as you can see in the picture I posted, you can barely taste or see the actual cookie. You should increase the cookie batter by 50% (if that‚Äôs even possible ??). Otherwise this recipe could be sold and fetch the baker bucks! One more thing is that my 10 year old daughter made this for me while I was asleep and she had no problem. My family devoured it in minutes. The other downside was that it created a mess of dishes, but that was probably just because of the technique I was using.

My sister first made brookies a few years ago, I fell in love and kept requesting for it. Finally I just decided to give it a try myself. Omg these are addictive and the so soft!!I've tried a couple pf others in my quest and they always turned out slight dry, too thick or something or another. This recipe is amazing. However I will be making a few changes next time upon others recommendations, first being the cookie dough spread on to the pan with a steel spoon without the chips and then pressing it in, (it was difficult to spread it in evenly, maybe even chill yhe dough slightly for 10 mins)

These brookies were perfect! I made them as directed from scratch. I happened to have mini chocolate chips on hand. I also lined the 9 x 13 pan with 1 solid piece of parchment paper before placing cookie dough in the pan. I then laid plastic wrap over the dough and used a small roller to even out the dough. It was the perfect amount to cover the bottom of the pan. Baked for 25 minutes at 350 degrees, they were done but not dry or hard. Cooled for 20 minutes and was able to lift them right out of the pan by picking up the edges of the parchment paper to finish cooling. Cut them into squares while slightly warm. We already ate a few! Fantastic!
They were delicious! I would totally make them again and again! I recommend them

Great recipe- leave it alone! Helpful hints- Do this- line 9 x13 with foil; spray foil with Vegetable spray then press the cookie dough with water on your fingers - so much easier! After you bake them- let cool completely- then carefully pull the the foil up moving the brookies to a cutting board- use a plastic spatula type knife to easily cut the brookies into even sized pieces!

I took a review suggestion and doubled the cookie recipe to ensure a nice cover for 13x9 pan. Also spread the dough before adding chips. It was way easier to sprinkle on after and gently pressing them in the dough. That left a nice thin layer of brownie. 
I also omitted white sugar in favor of slightly less coconut palm sugar which gives a nice flavor. Freaking perfect!
It was sooooo good and we are never going to stop using this recipe.
Simple to make and easy instructions to follow!! Super delicious too! The brownie flavor is strong but is really well balanced with the cookies! 110% recommend!
I love a good dessert mash-up! The best of both worlds.
its great!! I love the taste of the combination!! although I like it better cold or the next day I thing it just pulls the flavor together!!!

This recipe is absolute . It started out okay. Slid it in the oven, waited 20 minutes checked, waited 5 more minutes checked and it wasn't ready! Finally after 40 MINUTES, it still wasn't ready!! Like what? I added another 10 minutes, since some reviews said it took a longer. Waited and it still wasn't ready! I covered the top so it wouldn't burn and waited a few more minutes. Finally, I got absolutely tired of it. I decided to dump it on a cookie sheet, flatten it, and bake it. After 30 minutes, it baked! Waited for it to cool to try it and guess what? It tasted like absolute . You'd be better off buying store-bought cookie dough and brownie batter and clumping it to make a brookie.
I have had cookies and brownies with milk, but never had them both combined. But after today when my mom asks Cookies or Brownies I Shall say BROOKIES!
Recipe was a success, one thing though, I first poured the brownie batter and THEN the cookie batter like 'patches', looked much better and blended together perfectly. My friends loved them!
It was good but it had to cook longer than the recipe said

These are great! The bottom layer is thin - but the flavors mix better together, IMO. I just used the heel of my hand to press into pan, and worked well. 
I did use only one egg in brownie layer so chewier. 
Delicious! Made for a friend's bday, and she highly approves!
These are delicious. Like another reviewer, they took 40 minutes to be done baking, but what a wonderful result! My son has deemed them an ‚Äúessential‚Äù item.
Had to bake them longer. 40-45 minutes.
Very good recipe. I added pecans on half of the cookie dough before adding the brownie mix. This recipe is a keeper.

turned out kinda weird. the cookie (bottom layer) cooked faster than the brownie and the brownie took a while before it was ready and the oven's been used to bake other recipes that turned out well so it probably wasn't from the oven but idk
yum, but the cooking time was longer than it said in the method.

I followed others by making 1 and 1/2 cookie batter (2 eggs) and used only one egg in brownies. Baked about 30 minutes. 
My husband liked a lot.
Definitely making this again. It‚Äôs perfect for any social event or all to yourself lol. I do recommend putting it in longer for 1-2 more minutes to get the brownies flaky
This turned out great, will always use this recipe for all baking
I would make this again! Very tasty! Would maybe make a little more cookie dough next time or use a smaller pan. It was a little hard to spread.

When my dad warmed up the first time in the oven, he did a total of 33 minutes. When I brought them into my orcheatra rehearsal last week, most people said that it was burnt on the bottom. So, when me and my dad had our second try at it, the brownie part wasn't all that runny and it was a better success. It actually tastes like a brownie and a cookie at the same time. And he even warmed it up for 25 minutes too!
I was shocked when I saw all the negative reviews after I made this. I did add 10 minutes to the cooking time but other then that it turned out great! Moist and easy to serve.
I substituted all the sugar with brown cane sugar. It was still delicious but they seemed a bit dry and dense. It could be a simple baker's error.

I might make it again. It needs more cookie batter. Do a 1 to 1.5 ratio of the brownie to the cookie batter. There was too much brownie. I tried to bake it for 35 minutes and it burnt. When the toothpick comes out clean TAKE IT OUT! 20-25 minutes would be best like the recipe says.
Deeeeelishhh... super easy to whip together!

This is by far one of the best dessert recipes I‚Äôve ever baked. I made it exactly as instructed and ran into no issues having enough cookie dough to cover the 9 x 13 pan. Since the cookie dough was wetter than most recipes it spread quite easily. I would recommend whipping up the butter and sugar until it‚Äôs extremely fluffy to help with the spreading problem. The balance of brownie to cookie was perfect and not overly sweet. I usually tinker with recipes the second go round but I wouldn‚Äôt change a thing with this one. Excellent to take to work or a party. I did end up having to bake mine for 30 minutes instead of the suggested time. I originally made these for my husband to take to work but they were so delicious they never made it out of the house!

This is AMAZINGLY GOOD! The only change I made was I used dark chocolate chips instead of milk chocolate, and instead of whisking the dry ingredients together I sifted them. I did have to cut these while they were really hot so my husband could take some to work. They still cut just fine and are superb nice and warm. I am most assuredly making these again!

This is a delicious recipe. However, the next time I make it I will make the cookie portion a recipe and a half. The recipe as written is VERY skimpy for the bottom and hard to spread. Also, I needed to bake 40 minutes before the toothpick came out clean. At 25 minutes it was still in liquid form.

I made these once, & they were a lot of work! Now I make awesome 'brownie' cookies like this....... 1 box fudge brownie mix, 1/2 cup A/P flour, 2 lg. eggs, 5 Tbsp.veg. oil, 1 Tbsp.water, 1/2 cup mini ch. chips & a handful of chopped pecans. Mix well, drop in heaping tsp's full on cookie sheet (use parch.paper) & bake at 350F for 8-10 min. Cool on pan for a couple minutes then on a rack. Wonderful, fudgy cookies!! & so easy! Great for a 'chocolate fix'. *dough will be 'sticky'!!

I nixed the extra egg in the brownie mix...it definitely made a difference. Also, because I was making it for my coworkers, I put them in mini cupcake holders instead to stretch the recipe for more people. I placed 2 little chocolate chips in each of them. They were a hit in the office!
Great
I have made this a number of times for my grandkids as a birthday cake as 1. doesn't like cake 2. 2 just like it better than cake
I loved this recipe it‚Äôs one of my favorite Brookie recipe I highly recommend!
Absolute favorite dessert at my house. Everyone look fed this recipe. I make it again and again. Absolutely no changes whatsoever. You could make it for potluck.

Super easy to whip together. I took the advice of several others and pressed the cookie dough into the pan first, then added the chocolate chips. I used organic cane sugar, it's less refined and still has some of the molasses in it. I also used Hershey's Special Dark Cocoa, made the brownies a little richer. I used an 11x7 pan, it took about 40 minutes to bake. I will definitely be making these again!

Delicious! When I saw this recipe I knew I had to make it. It's a brownie AND a cookie. How could I refuse? It took a while to finish baking. Not 25 minutes. But it was definitely worth it. I will absolutely make it again. And even though the cookie dough doesn't seem like a lot it rises well. Just letting you know ;). Because I was worried about the amount of it. You won't be disappointed if you follow the recipe! :D
Turned out delicious! Have milk on hand. Yum!
These are very addicting and delicious!

I used part grated chocolate and part cocoa powder in the brownies; it does taste wonderful, but is less firm than brownies normally are. 
I'm going to try baking the cookie layer for 5 minutes before adding the brownie layer to firm up that layer.
Flavor isn't rich enough. The overall flavor didn't wow me, but it's edible.
good luck

PERFECT portions of both brownie and cookie layers for a 9x13 pan. I accidentally added a full tsp of salt to the brownie batter but I would gladly make the mistake again as it offsets the sweetness! Also used milk chocolate chips in the cookie layer, baked for 25 mins and it cooked just until done. quick and easy!

PERFECT portions of both brownie and cookie layers for a 9x13 pan. I accidentally added a full tsp of salt to the brownie batter but I would gladly make the mistake again as it offsets the sweetness! Also used milk chocolate chips in the cookie layer, baked for 25 mins and it cooked just until done. quick and easy!
no, i made no changes and yes i will make it again

Great idea Melanie. I made this recipe and it was a big hit. Goes together easy in two steps. I used walnuts instead of chocolate chips for the bottom b/c I don't care for chocolate chips. Turned out great! Thank you for sharing it.

Really did love this recipe! 

I did substitute Crisco buttered flavored shortening for the butter (my late mother-in-law used it in her chocolate chip cookie recipe!) 

Will definitely be adding this recipe to my cooking file!

These are a family favorite! They are rich, so I cut them into smal squares and perfect for chocolate cravings! I also find that these are best if you once and a half the cookie dough recipe, but keep the ingredients the same for the brownie layer. I bake these for 28 minutes and then turn the oven down to 325 degrees and bake for 7-10 minutes longer.
The only change we made was putting a layer of butter cream frosting on top. My daughter made them for a project at school and they were a hit!!

Made the brookies with my 9 yr old niece and it came out great. It was sweet but not as tooth shattering as I thought it might be. We didn't have trouble with spreading the cookie layer out. I think the trick is to make sure your cream the butter and sugar well. Thanks for the recipe, Melanie B!

This was perfect! Just what a snowy day called for, but definitely an anytime treat! Made this with my 12 yr old daughter. WE used boxed brownies and the cookie recipe attached. Added an extra egg to the boxed brownies to make them less dense. Served with vanilla ice cream to increase the sinfulness!This treat was a winner!
I used a nonstick rubber cupcake sheet instead of a pan.
Delicious, but took longer to cook than recipe directions.
These were SO good, took them to a movie night and they were gone super quick. Definitely recommend.

Absolutely delicious--you get the fudge brownie on top and the Toll House bar-style cookie on the bottom. You can't go wrong. 

I doubled the recipes, so mine did take longer to bake, but I didn't worry too much about knife sticking and whatnot--after about ten extra minutes, I turned off the oven and let the cookies sit inside for a bit before removing them to the cooling rack. The brownie layer was nice and fudgy. 

Incidentally, I think I overbeat the brownie batter with my Kitchen Aid--but the result was this amazing, hard "coating" on top that looked, felt, and tasted like chocolate fortune cookie. As accidents go, I'll take it.

I changed it a little, and instead of putting the chocolate chip cookie on the bottom, I spread it out like pie dough on the pan, then added the brownie layer into it. Even though making the brownie layer one time was not enough(I had to make the brownie layer two times to have enough mixture), it turned out great and tastes amazing.

came out more cakey than I thought but they were still very good!!! next time I'll use 1 less egg and see how that'll works. also will be making the correction to add chocolate chips on top of cookie dough mixture but definitely will be making again!!

I followed the recipe to the T, and I didnt have enough cookie batter to cover even a 9 x 9 pan.

It isnt explained how the cookie layer should be layed out. Overall I'm not impressed I'll try again, taste was mediocre and cook time was longer. I'll retry and adjust from my next attempt

This was so good. However, it definitely took longer to bake than the recipe called for. 

Otherwise, will 100% make again.
Made recipe as written came out great. Added walnuts to half brownie top. Cooked for 28min

Can use store-bought cookie dough and your own brownie recipe. Layer in reverse. Put the brownie layer on the bottom and drop little spoonfuls of the cookie dough all over the top until covered. Works much better because it removes the spreading problems referred to by other reviewers, it's easier to tell when it's done because you can judge the color of the cookie layer, and it just looks prettier in my opinion! I had to bake it for 30 minutes. The cookie layer was dark tan when it was done, almost brown.
